ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] A use for the gemcutter?
ygData.msgSnippet: yep, yep, I have a gemcutter in the bank.. The last time I tried to right click on a gem, the hard drive churned for a brief moment, but nothing happened to
ygData.messageBody:
yep, yep, I have a gemcutter in the bank..

The last time I tried to right click on a gem, the
hard drive churned for a brief moment, but nothing
happened to the gem.

I'll try when I get home tonight

Gazamel Prime
Solusek Ro
Champion of Ak'Anon

--- jbuckingham@... wrote:
> Okie, take this with a grain of salt, becasue I
> haven't verified it..
>
> Talking to an enchanter friend of mine over the
> water-cooler at work, and
> he gave me the following info about a gemcutter that
> he borrowed.
>
> Take one gem (he was using rubies), with it in the
> cursor right click on
> the gemcutter.
> The gem should now be "A fine ruby" (or whatever)
> Combine the fine ruby as you would any other gem +
> metal ( he was making
> plat ruby veils)
> Aparently the fine gems make the same items as the
> regular one, but have a
> lower trivial and therefore higher success rate..
>
> Should be easy enough to verify, as it's not
> destructive and doesnt involve
> combing the gemcutter with anything, and you can
> always try with a cheap
> gem.. Anyone got one in the bank?
>
>
>
>
>
